name: The Plaza & Plaza Regency Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i have recently returned from a week at the Plaza Regency. We had our reservations having read the reviews but were willing to keep an open mind. On arrival around 9pm we went in to the reception at the Plaza side and were told that our room would actually be in the Plaza Regency side. I have to admit that my heart sank having read that this was the "poorer" of the 2 sides. I needn't have concerned myself. The staff at reception were friendly and efficient and check in was done quickly and smoothly. There were 2 lifts, one slightly larger than the other and both in working order, if a little slow. Our room was on the second floor and we had requested a side sea view room as we wanted to make sure that we had a balcony. What we were given was a front sea view room with balcony and with absolutely breathtaking views of the sea. Even lying on the bed you could not miss the ocean views. The room itself was fairly small, but it was spotlessly clean and comfortable and the bathroom was adequate for what we needed. When we are spending time in our room on holiday we are usually on the balcony anyway so the size of the room is not really an issue for us, but it may have been a bit cramped if we were there for 2 weeks. Being on the second floor meant we had quite a lot of noise from the street so if you are a light sleeper you may need a room on a higher floor, but it was fine for us. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels provided daily. The beds were changed at least twice during our stay which was fine as well.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!

reviews.text: The hotel itself was quite basic but the rooftop pool and terrace were lovely and had great views. The entertainment on the roof at night was dreadful, but i suppose at least they had something on. We did not order any food during our stay having booked on a room only basis and we were very glad of this as we walked through the restaurant one evening and found the restaurant to be extremely foul smelling. There were plenty of places nearby to eat though, as well as a small supermarket around the corner selling fresh fruit and pastries etc in the mornings.
reviews.title: Not worth the risk!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was excellent as both Sliema and St Julian's could be easily reached on foot and local buses stopped outside to go all over the island. Also plenty of shops, bars restaurants and an HSBC cash machine on the doorstep.
reviews.title: Nice views

reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel facilities and comfort to be adequate. For the views alone we would not hesitate to return!
reviews.title: Plaza OK, Plaza Regency if your desperate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem with this place is that it's two hotels; one with some of the worst rooms I've ever had the misfortune to stay in (Regency), and the other upgraded to a reasonable standard. Considering your paying the same price for both, and don't know which hotel you'll be allocated until you arrive, it really isn't worth the risk!
reviews.title: "Good location"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from this hotel.It appers a little dated but is clean and friendly.Great base for getting round the island on the buses. Cheap at 12 euros for the week.The staff i found were helpful, we were not given the right room when we arrived but it was rectified the next day so were the problems with the plumbing. Breakfast was ok.There was a good selection ,didnt eat the evening meals so cant comment.It is a place more suited to the more mature person. The entertainment was ok ,only on in bar on roof at night.There is night life round the corner in paceville but if you want want kareoke bars and fish and chips then its not for you First time we have been to Malta in June and found it chilly at night. All in all a nice 3 star hotel
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit the the Plaza/Plaza Regency (2009) and this year.
reviews.title: Beware and check

reviews.text: Over all no comparison because last time we stayed in the Plaza side. This time we were put in the Plaza Regency side What a let down in a small room blue and grey paintwork, depressing had to have the lights on in the daytime to see. Paid £990-00 for this half board for two weeks. Then had to pay 12 euro per night to upgrade as they call it (132 euro from our spending money) to get a better room. It also apears talking to other people we were not the only ones.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: I wont be back!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Think twice

reviews.text: Nothing wrong with Malta i love it
reviews.title: There are 2 sides: The Plaza/The Plaza Regency

reviews.text: We have just come back from a week in Malta and spent our first night at the Plaza. The hotel is located next to it's sister hotel just off the busy Silema seafront road. The hotel is a decent three star standard and our room was very large, clean and modern. They had provided a bed for our little girl at no extra charge and prepared a cake for her birthday that we'd ordered in advance. The rooftop pool was a little more tired looking than in the website picture. There is a rooftop bar.
reviews.title: Fine for a couple of nights
Best holiday,fab locals,clean friendly hotel.
reviews.text: All in all, we had a great sized room for the price with extra's we weren't expecting like a small cooking area. However, for some reason I can't put my finger on, this wasn't a hotel or area that I took to at all. It just seemed to lack a bit of soul and character!

We have just returned from Sliema and stayed at The Plaza hotel. Hotel was clean and friendly.Food was very nice.However,we did try Peppis across the road from the hotel which was just as nice.Rooms cleaned everyday,entertainment was good,roof top pool we found was cold. Make sure you stay in a room from the 6th floor if you are wanting a view. Transport was very good,buses every seven minutes,day passes were very good.Sightseeing buses well worth using north and south of the island.We did both as well as a harbour cruise which you get for free when booking sightseeing tours. Bus stop right outside the hotel.Mr softy up the road does very nice wine,if they don't have what you like they will do all they can to get for you.Local pub to the right of the hotel very friendly local people. Local fishing villages well worth a visit. We will be visiting again next year for sure. Weather can be very hot and would need high factor suncream.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: I have just returned from a ten day stay at the Plaza and what a wonderful stay it was, The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff are helpful and courteous and as far as the meals are concerned they cater for everyone.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.text: Can't fault it. So thanks to all concerned for making our stay so great.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in room 634 on the 6th floor of the Plaza Studio Complex Hotel on the Sliema sea front with a magnificent bay view. Our large a/c bedroom included a kitchenette and sofa area with a huge balcony. The large bathroom had a bathtub and shower cubicle. Go for half board cause buffet breakfast and buffet evening meal is plentiful, and the choice is varied and well presented. The hotel is close to all amenities with a bus stop in front of the hotel's main entrance. Though on the main road the bedroom was very quiet. It is a bargain compared to other hotels in the vicinity and well worth the price we paid for. We will definitely make use of this hotel again and will recommend it to family and friends.
reviews.title: Best choice for a clean, quiet and yet central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from a 2 week holiday at the plaza hotel a bit worried over some reviews before we went no need to have been concerned lovely clean and friendly hotel food always hot and the best thing was the location right on sea front nice coffee shop below hotel 20 min strollinto center of sliema definately going back
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night break in the plaza suites. They are modern but basic. This was fine for us. We were bed and breakfast and breakfast was ok. It location is at the end of sliema and almost in st Julian's. We liked this as was nice and quiet and a nice walk to st Julians where most restaurants and bars were situated. Not sure on price of hotel as we won the accomodation in competition from hotels4u. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Most staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Basic and modern

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week, but not as a resort holiday, it was more of a city break type holiday. The hotel was fine for this but I can imagine people being dissappointed with the facilities if they were doing resort type of holiday. The room was spacious, clean and we had a fridge, sink and cooker rings although we only used the fridge,for cold drinks. Brekfasts were OK but rarely was there any yogurt on offer to accompany the meusli. Strangely enough the sausages were really good.Biggest downside were the lifts, slow and not enough of them . But hey, you get what you pay for and overall it was worth the money.Found the staff to be friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: "Pretty good value for money"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just nice to feel the heat of the sun.
reviews.title: plaza malta

aka: The Plaza & Plaza Regency Hotel Sliema
